stanza.line: I never saw that you did paintingneed
And therefore to your fair no paintingset
I found or thought I found you didexceed
That barren tender of a poetdebt
And therefore have I slept in yourreport
That you your self being extant well mightshow
How far a modern quill doth come tooshort
Speaking of worth what worth in you dothgrow
This silence for my sin you didimpute
Which shall be most my glory being dumb
For I impair not beauty beingmute
When others would give life and bring a tomb
There lives more life in one of your fair eyes
Than both your poets can in praise devise
